descriptionSpanish: Ave distintiva de color rojo brillante con cresta prominente y pico fuerte para comer semillas.
descriptionEnglish: Distinctive red bird with a prominent crest and strong beak for seed-eating.
funFact: Cardinals are one of the few bird species where both males and females sing.

descriptionSpanish: Córvido inteligente con plumaje azul brillante y cresta distintiva.
descriptionEnglish: Intelligent corvid with bright blue plumage and a distinctive crest.
funFact: Blue Jays can mimic the calls of hawks to warn other birds or scare away competitors.

descriptionSpanish: Tordo común conocido por su pecho naranja-rojo y canto melodioso.
descriptionEnglish: Common thrush known for its orange-red breast and melodious song.
funFact: American Robins can eat up to 14 feet of earthworms in a single day.

descriptionSpanish: Ave diminuta capaz de mantenerse suspendida en el aire y volar hacia atrás, con plumaje iridiscente.
descriptionEnglish: Tiny bird capable of hovering and flying backwards, with iridescent plumage.
funFact: Hummingbirds can beat their wings up to 80 times per second.

descriptionSpanish: Búho grande con penachos distintivos en las orejas y garras poderosas para cazar.
descriptionEnglish: Large owl with distinctive ear tufts and powerful talons for hunting.
funFact: Great Horned Owls can exert a grip strength of 28 pounds, enough to crush their prey's spine.

descriptionSpanish: Carpintero de tamaño mediano con patrón de barras en la espalda y gorro rojo.
descriptionEnglish: Medium-sized woodpecker with barred back pattern and red cap.
funFact: Woodpeckers can peck 20 times per second without getting a headache.

descriptionSpanish: Rapaz majestuosa con cabeza blanca distintiva y pico amarillo poderoso.
descriptionEnglish: Majestic raptor with distinctive white head and powerful yellow beak.
funFact: Bald Eagles can see fish from up to a mile away.

descriptionSpanish: Ave espectacular conocida por sus plumas de cola iridiscentes y exhibición de cortejo.
descriptionEnglish: Spectacular bird known for its iridescent tail feathers and courtship display.
funFact: A peacock's train can be over 6 feet long and contain over 200 feathers.

descriptionSpanish: Ave zancuda alta con plumaje rosa distintivo de dieta rica en carotenoides.
descriptionEnglish: Tall wading bird with distinctive pink plumage from carotenoid-rich diet.
funFact: Flamingos are pink because of the carotenoids in the algae and crustaceans they eat.

descriptionSpanish: Animal más rápido de la Tierra, capaz de zambullirse a velocidades superiores a 240 mph.
descriptionEnglish: Fastest animal on Earth, capable of diving at speeds over 240 mph.
funFact: Peregrine Falcons have been clocked diving at speeds of 242 mph.
